José Bruno Malaquias

  • Endereço para acessar este CV: http://lattes.cnpq.br/1103370910009848
  • Última atualização do currículo em 13/09/2019

Graduação em Engenharia Agronômica (UFPB). Mestrado e Doutorado em Entomologia (ESALQ/USP). Fui funcionário da Embrapa Algodão (2011-2015). Realizei estágio como estudante visitante (Doutorado sanduíche) na Mississippi State University-USA (Out de 2017- Nov 2018). Tenho experiência com o seguinte tema: bioecologia aplicada ao MIP, e tenho trabalhado/colaborado com Pesquisadores do Brasil e do exterior de forma multi e interdisciplinar nas áreas "biologia computacional em entomologia" e "métodos quantitativos". Nos últimos anos tenho despertado interesse por modelos computacionais Bayesianos combinados com dados bioecológicos com aplicações em alterações genéticas/populacionais de artrópodes. Atualmente sou bolsista de Pós-Doutorado (FAPESP), atuando no Instituto de Biociências [Departamento de Bioestatística] da UNESP-Botucatu. (Texto informado pelo autor)

2017 - 2018
Ecological Modeling of the Resistance Evolution of Spodoptera frugiperda on Bt Cotton Mediated by Seed Contamination and Temperature Increasing
Descrição: Seed contamination as well as the increase in temperature may result in a high risk of the resistance evolution of pests on Bt cultivars; however, this information - especially analyzed with the bio-mathematical model - is still considered incipient in neotropical conditions, inspiring and justifying further studies in that direction. In this regard, the current project intends to describe with computational simulations the resistance evolution of Spodoptera frugiperda (J.E. Smith) (Lepidoptera: Noctuidae) in Bt cotton. We will analyze with deterministic and stochastic models the frequency of the resistant individuals of S. frugiperda on Bt cotton varieties. Currently, in Brazil, or in similar conditions, the modeling of dispersion and resistance evolution is a necessary procedure to guide practitioners in the design of an effective resistance management program, constituting a tool capable of elucidating the failures or effectiveness of the technology according to the structure of the landscape. We intend to explain the reasons of controlling non-success of S. frugiperda with simulation, but the particularity of the present proposal is that we will use real data of movement obtained from automated video system, gene expression of caterpillar strains and larval dispersal in different refuge scenarios under field conditions. The biological data were collected with the support of the FAPESP Scholarships in Brazil - Doctorate (grant number: 15/20380-8) and with Research Projects - Thematic Grants (grant number: 14/16609-7)..
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: José Bruno Malaquias - Integrante / Celso Omoto - Integrante / Ramalho, F. S. - Integrante / Wesley A. C. Godoy - Coordenador / Michael A Caprio - Integrante.
Financiador(es): Fundação de Amparo à Pesquisa do Estado de São Paulo - Bolsa.
2015 - 2019
Modelagem ecológica da dispersão larval de Spodoptera frugiperda (Lepidoptera: Noctuidae) em algodão Bt: implicações para evolução e manejo da resistência
Descrição: The demand for information in a systematic way about ecology of target pests of transgenic plants has increased in recent decades due to the growing interest in this new technology in pest management. Such information contributes the optimization of regional resistance management within the concept of population control pests in wide areas. Mobility larvae in agricultural ecosystems when the occurrence of contamination of Bt crops, intentionally or unintentionally - has been the subject of study by several researchers, however information about larval mobility in tropical conditions are still scarce. Under these conditions it is possible that caterpillars with some level of tolerance to Bt cotton, when they start feeding on cotton plant non-Bt can disperse and feed on Bt cotton plants, survive, reach adulthood and produce offspring, increasing probability of occurrence of individuals having the resistance allele with a higher frequency than expected. Moreover, high temperatures have a decreasing effect on the expression of Bt toxins. The above scenario creates opportunity for hypothesis testing on behavioral aspects of Spodoptera frugiperda (JE Smith) (Lepidoptera: Noctuidae). Therefore the main objective of our project is to understand the feeding behavior of the pest in field and laboratory conditions in order to insert a computational modeling component to study the spatial dynamics of the larvae. Ongoing scholarship in Brazil is supported by FAPESP (Doctorate grant number: 15/20380-8) and with Research Projects - Thematic grant number: 14/16609-7)..
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.
Alunos envolvidos: Doutorado: (1) .

Integrantes: José Bruno Malaquias - Integrante / Celso Omoto - Integrante / Ramalho, F. S. - Integrante / Wesley A. C. Godoy - Coordenador.
Financiador(es): Fundação de Amparo à Pesquisa do Estado de São Paulo - Bolsa.
